stanzas: Blessed is everyone that feareth the Lord that walketh in his ways. For thou shalt eat of the labour of thy hands, happy shalt thou be.
And it shall be, and it shall be, it shall be well with thee. Behold, that thus shall a man be blessed that feareth the Lord.
Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine by the sides of thine house. Thy children like olive plants round about thy table.
And it shall be, and it shall be, it shall be well with thee. Behold, that thus shall a man be blessed that feareth the Lord.
Behold that thus shall a man be blessed that feareth the Lord.
